articles.title: Chinese Diplomats Pay Condolatory Visits to DPRK Missions in Different Countries
articles.content:
Chinese Diplomats Pay Condolatory Visits to DPRK Missions in Different Countries
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of China in various countries and at international organizations paid condolatory visits to DPRK missions from Dec. 20 to 25 last year on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					The Chinese consul general in Khabarovsk of Russia said after expressing profound condolences:
					
					After hearing the sad news about the demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il, the leadership and people of China mourned his passing in bitter grief. They are remembering him, sharing sorrow with the Korean people suffering the pain at his loss.
					
					It is something rare that all the senior officials of the party and state of China expressed condolences. This can be seen only between the countries which have relations of comradeship.
					
					China and the DPRK demonstrated before the world that they are in the relationship of comradeship.
					
					The cause of Comrade Kim Jong Il who developed the Sino-DPRK relations on a fresh higher level will be carried forward.
					
					The Chinese ambassador to Malaysia wrote in the mourners' book:  Comrade Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people and the closest friend of the Chinese people. He made a great contribution to the cause of socialism in the DPRK and the development of the Sino-DPRK friendship and cooperation. We will never forget him. The great leader of the Korean people Comrade Kim Jong Il will be immortal.
					
					The Chinese ambassador to Guinea noted:
					
					The demise of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il is a great loss to all the peoples of China and the DPRK.
					
					He was an energetic statesman who devoted all his wisdom and energies to the peace and security in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					I believe under the leadership of Comrade General Kim Jong Un the Korean people will successfully carry forward the revolutionary cause to which Comrade Kim Jong Il dedicated his whole life.

articles.title: Italians Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Italians Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Development Bank of the Mediterranean and chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, and Mauro Baeli, president of C.I. S. Estero Group of Italy, visited the DPRK mission for the third time on Dec. 27 last year to mourn demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					They placed a large wreath and floral basket at his portrait before expressing condolences.
					
					Giancarlo Elia Valori said: Now is Dec. 28 in Korean time, the saddest day when we bid last farewell to Comrade Kim Jong Il. We came here again with our bitter grief at the fact that we are unable to fly to Pyongyang where the solemn ceremony of paying last farewell to him is taking place.
					
					He wrote in the mourner's book that Kim Jong Il's feats would be recorded in one page of history.
					
					Mauro Baeli said: 
					
					We share the sorrow with the Korean people who suffered the great national misfortune by the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il. In the mourning period we live in Korean time, not in Italian time, cherishing the memory of him in humble reverence.
					
					Now is 00:00 on Dec. 28 in Korean time. I can hardly repress my bitter grief at the fact that we have to bid last farewell to him.
					
					Recalling in tears the loving care and benevolence shown for his family by Kim Jong Il, Mauro Baeli expressed belief that the dear respected Kim Jong Un would turn the DPRK into a more prosperous and powerful country true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Party Leader of Ukraine
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Party Leader of Ukraine
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 25 last year received a message of condolence from Petro Nikolayevich Symonenko, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Ukrainian Communist Party, on the passing away of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					He said in the message that Kim Jong Il would be remembered by the present and future generations of the DPRK and all the world progressives as a man who devoted his whole life and revolutionary enthusiasm to consolidating the gains of the socialist society and injected fresh vitality into the Korean people advancing along the road of progress and prosperity.
					
					On behalf of the C.C., the Ukrainian Communist Party and on his own, the first secretary expressed the deepest condolences and sympathy to Kim Jong Un and all the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from FAO Director-General
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from FAO Director-General
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 31 received a condolence message from Jaques Diouf, director-general of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations on the passing of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					The message said:
					
					It was with great sadness that I heard the sad news that Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, passed away. 
					
					I, on behalf of the FAO and on my own, would like to express sincere condolences to Your Excellency and the government of the DPRK. 
					
					Please accept, Your Excellency, the assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation of Academy of Agricultural Science Leaves for Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation of Academy of Agricultural Science Leaves for Guinea
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Academy of Agricultural Science led by its President Kye Yong Sam left here by air on Tuesday to take part in the event marking the 30th anniversary of Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Calls for Promoting Sports Development
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Calls for Promoting Sports Development
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial released in the DPRK indicates a way for promoting the sports development of the country.
					It calls for increasing the heated enthusiasm for sports by enhancing public interest in physical culture and sports and making them part of people's everyday life and habit.
					
					The call is motivated by the intention to make the country a football power and sports power by encouraging all people to take part in sports activities and producing many competent reserve sportspersons.
					
					Diverse mass sports events took place in the country last year, raising public interest in sports and training many up-and-coming sportspersons. 
					
					Sportspersons scored good results in international tournaments last year, bagging many gold medals in weightlifting, wrestling, shooting, marathon, boxing, track-and-field and other events. 
					
					The DPRK boys were qualified for the 2012 Asian U-16 and U-19 football championships and girls for the 2012 Olympic Games and for the 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup.
					
					The country won 4 trophies, 19 gold medals, 3 silver medals and 3 bronze medals to finish first in the team standings in the 17th ITF World Taekwon-Do Championship, which took place in Pyongyang in September last year.

articles.title: Regional Organization Praises Kim Jong Un as Center of Unity of Progressives
articles.content:
Regional Organization Praises Kim Jong Un as Center of Unity of Progressives
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted an article captioned "For the single-minded unity around Comrade Kim Jong Un" illustrated with a portrait of leader Kim Jong Il on its internet homepage on Dec. 28 last year on his demise.
					The article said:
					
					At this sad moment of bidding last farewell to Comrade Kim Jong Il the people recollect in grief July 17 years ago.
					
					Although President Kim Il Sung passed away, the party, army and people of the DPRK at that time turned out to implement the President's behests, firmly rallied around Comrade Kim Jong Il, and victoriously concluded the Arduous March, the  forced march on that road.
					
					Comrade Kim Jong Un is the center of the unity of not only the Korean nation but all the progressives.
					
					The world will extend unreserved support to Comrade Kim Jong Un who develops the DPRK, the bulwark of socialism, and leads the people's struggle of all the countries for independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Autograph to Officials and Working People of Different Units
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Autograph to Officials and Working People of Different Units
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, on Dec. 30 last year sent his autograph to officials and working people of different units. They sent him letters pledging to dynamically struggle for new victory of the Juche revolution by turning the sorrow at the greatest loss to the nation into a thousand-fold strength and courage.
					The letters of loyalty were presented by officials, employees and builders of Kim Il Sung University, construction site of the Huichon Power Station, Pisan Cooperative Farm in Anbyon County, Kwangbok Area Supermarket, Hana Music Information Center, Taean Heavy Machine Complex, Ryongsong Machine Complex, Mansudae Art Troupe, National Theatrical Troupe, 413 Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and units under the Ministry of People's Security.
					
					In their letters they dealt in tears with the indescribable sorrow at the untimely loss of leader Kim Jong Il whom they had trusted and followed like the Heaven and the dedication and efforts made by him for the country and the people till the last moments of his life.
					
					When Kim Jong Un is in good health, Kim Il Sung's nation will prosper and Kim Jong Il's Korea will shine, they said, earnestly wishing Kim Jong Un good health for the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche, national reunification and happiness of generations to come.

articles.title: Mass Rally Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Mass Rally Held in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang city mass rally took place at Kim Il Sung Square Tuesday to carry through the decision of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial and respond to the letter of the South Hamgyong provincial working people. 
					Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and other senior officials and masses from all walks of life, more than 100 000 in all.
					
					Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, noted in his report at the rally that the whole party and army and all the people have turned out in the grand advance for the new centenary of the Juche era with high pride of having the dear respected Kim Jong Un as the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army after seeing out the year 2011 in tears of blood.
					
					He said:
					
					Last year radical changes and leap forward took place in the building of a prosperous and powerful nation under the energetic guidance of leader Kim Jong Il and the 100-year history of the Juche era was brought to a close resplendently. 
					
					As long as there are the invincible Party, army and state developed by Kim Jong Il, the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and the excellent people supporting their leaders faithfully through generations, the cause of building a thriving country is sure to emerge victorious.
					
					Calling upon all the people to cherish the absolute faith that Kim Jong Il will always be with us and glorify his revolutionary life and feats forever and thoroughly implement his behests, the reporter further said:
					
					All the officials, party members and other working people should devotedly defend Kim Jong Un and remain loyal to his idea and leadership.
					
					The light industry and agriculture should produce quality goods in a larger quantity and make leap forward in the overall agricultural production in order to bring about a decisive turn in improving the people's living standard. The electric-power and coal-mining industries should make breakthrough for grand advance through the production charge under the flames of Hamnam.
					
					All sectors and units should fiercely flare up the flames of industrial revolution in the new century to push back the frontiers of technology and accelerate the drive for putting the national economy on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis.
					
					Capital builders and all the citizens in Pyongyang should complete the construction in the Mansudae area and other major projects on the highest level and effect a radical turn in urban management and landscaping, thus ushering in a new heyday of Pyongyang.
					
					Taking the floor at the rally were Pak Hyong Ryol, manager of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, Kim Yong Bok, chairwoman of the management board of the Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm, Ri Ung Il, first secretary of the youth league committee of Kim Il Sung University, and Ri Won Chol, vice-president of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					They vowed to carry through the above-said decision, the joint calls and the tasks laid down in the joint New Year editorial with the conviction that the Korean people will surely emerge victorious under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Flames of Hamnam Serve as Banner of Great Victory in Economic Construction
articles.content:
Flames of Hamnam Serve as Banner of Great Victory in Economic Construction
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The flames of Hamnam (South Hamgyong Province) represent the banner of the general offensive for the great victory in 2012, a banner of fresh change, says the joint New Year editorial published by the DPRK's major newspapers Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi.
					The flames are based on the spirit of carrying out the tasks entrusted by the Workers' Party of Korea in the shortest possible period and on the highest possible level and rising beyond the global standards by drawing on one's own strength, and the traits of taking the lead in opening the gates of prosperity in one's own home town and at one's own workplace.
					
					The flames were kindled by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					He gave field guidance to South Hamgyong Province on scores of occasions in recent three years alone.
					
					His guidance has brought about a rapid progress in the province's overall economic sectors, including the production of vinalon fiber, fertilizers, geothermal equipment, custom-built equipment, minerals, non-ferrous metal, fruits and grain.
					
					The magnesia clinker industry is based on locally available fuel and the February 8 Vinalon Complex is in full operation.
					
					The first-stage gasification project of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, which would have taken more than ten years, was completed in two and a half years. 
					
					The province has also created culture of a new style suitable for the working class and facelifted towns and villages.
					
					The flames of Hamnam will encourage the people throughout the country to make a leap forward in the economic construction this year, too.

articles.title: 100-year History of Juche Era Resplendent with Great Victories
articles.content:
100-year History of Juche Era Resplendent with Great Victories
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial says the 100-year history of the Juche era is resplendent with great victories and changes brought about by the patriotic devotion of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					Kim Jong Il continued his field guidance tours of all parts of the country until his last days without taking time to have rest.
					
					Last year the DPRK witnessed tremendous achievements in the building of a prosperous and powerful nation. Solid foundations for building a strong economy were laid in the country.
					
					The torch of the industrial revolution in the new century was kindled in industrial establishments across the country, including the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Factory, and the country's economy has entered the stage of building a powerful country with the knowledge-based economy. 
					
					Great achievements have also been made in the effort for use of geothermal and solar energies.
					
					The Huichon Power Station and many other large construction projects have been carried out throughout the country.
					
					South Hamgyong Province has taken the lead in the effort for the building of a strong economy. 
					
					Amidst the upsurge for improving the people's living standard, light industry factories were renovated and modern stockbreeding and fish and fruit farming bases were constructed.
					
					A gigantic project for turning the capital city of Pyongyang into a world-class magnificent city is going on and socialist fairylands have emerged in different parts of the country.
					
					The drama "We Will Recollect Today" and other masterpieces representing literature and arts of the Songun (military-first) were created one after another and a great progress made in popular art.

articles.title: New Book Published in DPRK
articles.content:
New Book Published in DPRK
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Vol. 4 "Genius of Creation" of book in five volumes "Comrade Kim Jong Il, Legendary Great Man" has been published in the DPRK.
					This volume, consisting of four chapters, expounds deeply in an ideo-theoretical way that leader Kim Jong Il is a peerlessly great man as he ushered in the great heyday of prosperity unprecedented in the Korean nation's history of 5 000 years and made a history of prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation crown with victory and glory. 
					
					Chapter 1 "The Peerlessly Great Man with Lofty Ideal of Creation" tells about the greatness of Kim Jong Il who laid a solid ideo-theoretical and practical groundwork for prosperity of the country and the nation and mankind with his unusual wisdom and scientific insight.
					
					Chapter 2 "Man of Creativity Possessed of Distinguished Creative Disposition" shows the distinguished creative temper of Kim Jong Il who created everything at the highest level and realized in a big and bold way any formidable, tremendous changes. 
					
					Chapter 3 "A Doer Working Miracles in Unique Creative Manner" deals with the greatness of Kim Jong Il who opened up the magnificent era of miracles, innovation and rapid progress unprecedented in history.
					
					Chapter 4 "The Leader Who Set a Model of Century in Creation" elaborated on the undying feats and great personality of Kim Jong Il who ushered in a new era of national prosperity with indefatigable creative zeal and indomitable efforts, enjoying his greatest joy in creation.

articles.title: Third Commodity Exhibition Held at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1
articles.content:
Third Commodity Exhibition Held at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The third commodity exhibition was opened at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1.
					On display there are more than 5.9 million consumer goods of some 2 800 varieties produced by hundreds of factories and enterprises, work-teams for the production of consumer goods through the utilization of various materials available in the field of commercial service, units of joint venture and collaboration, etc. across the country.
					
					Some 70 more units took part in the exhibition and some 1 400 more varieties of products were put on display than the previous exhibition. 
					
					This exhibition was opened at the instruction given by leader Kim Jong Il to hold the next exhibition on a larger-scale to be more significant, while looking round the second commodity exhibition last July.
					
					An opening ceremony of the exhibition was held on Tuesday.
					
					Present there were Vice-Premier Ri Mu Yong, Minister of Commerce Kim Pong Chol, officials concerned and officials of ministries, national institutions and units for the supply of commodities and working people.
					
					Ri Mu Yong made an inaugural speech.
					
					At the end of the ceremony, the participants went round the exhibition.
					
					They posed for a long while before the new products made of Juche fibre including vinalon blanket and clothing materials, apple cider and apple perfume, recollecting Kim Jong Il who considered the joy of people as his happiness.

articles.title: Pyongyang September 15 Weekly Nursery
articles.content:
Pyongyang September 15 Weekly Nursery
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang September 15 Weekly Nursery is located in Central District.
					It was built on September 15, 1969, under the instructions of President Kim Il Sung to bring up the children well. It is one of the model nurseries in the country in scale, equipment, management, health care and emotional education for children.
					
					It has two five-storey main buildings, three-storey refectory, two-storey amusement centre, children's ward and play yard.
					
					The main buildings accommodate some 500 children at the age from 2 and a half to 4 and more than 150 kindergarteners. Each floor has bedrooms, play hall, ultraviolet treatment room and bathrooms.
					
					The nursery pays close attention to taking care of the children's nutrition and health and bringing them up in a cultural and scientific way.
					
					President Kim Il Sung visited the nursery on January 4, 1972.
					
					The nursery was awarded the Order of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Research Institute Conducive to Children's Health Improvement
articles.content:
Research Institute Conducive to Children's Health Improvement
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Research Institute for Nutrition Care of Children affiliated with the Academy of Medical Science in Pyongyang works on scientific researches in nutrition, health and hygiene care of the children.
					In recent years the research institute has successfully made researches in infant powdered milk, nutritive powdered milk and micronutrient, while producing medicines good for the growth of children.
					
					It, with modern equipment, manufactures a variety of nutrients and nutritive drinks necessary for children's growth.
					
					Min Kyong Hyon, vice-director of the research institute, told KCNA that infant powdered milk made from beans is popular among local and foreign people.
					
					The research institute boasts of a lot of scientists and technicians honored with academic degrees and titles.
					
					The institute has different laboratories, pilot factory and children's ward equipped with modern diagnosis and treatment apparatuses.
					
					It also examines the hygienic condition and quality of foodstuffs.
					
					It has cooperated with the United Nations Children's Fund, World Health Organization and other international agencies and organizations.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Condemns Japan for Rubbing Salt into Wounds of Koreans Stricken with Grief over Greatest Loss
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Condemns Japan for Rubbing Salt into Wounds of Koreans Stricken with Grief over Greatest Loss
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The whole world was in bitter grief at the end of the last year over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, peerlessly great man produced by mankind and great leader recognized by the world.
					Heads of state and governments, party leaders, organizations and personages of different countries mourned his demise in humblest reverence and sincerely sympathized and encouraged the Korean people.
					
					Former Prime Minister Koizumi and other officials of Japan sent condolence messages to the DPRK and visited the Korean Hall to express deep condolences over his demise.
					
					The Japanese authorities, however, committed unpardonable acts.
					
					They officially revealed their hostile stand, saying "the government has no intention to express condolences". Worse still, they let loose such balderdash as uttering it was their hope that the great loss the Korean nation suffered would not adversely affect the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Japanese Prime Minister Noda convened a "security meeting" on December 19 at which he instructed all the ministries and agencies to strengthen the posture for gathering information about north Korea and keep full readiness. 
					
					The government set up a "Cabinet room for measures" at the Crisis Management Center of the Residence of the Prime Minister and ordered the "Self-Defense Forces" and the Coast Guard Agency to step up the alert posture. He also called for "examining measures for evacuating Japanese residing in south Korea in the event of contingency."
					
					Japan, a neighbor, behaved recklessly, betraying its bitterness towards the DPRK at a time when personages of all social standings in the world were mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence. This glaringly proves in what bitterness towards the DPRK the Japanese politicians were steeped.
					
					The Japanese authorities' evil actions found a more striking manifestation in the fact that they desperately blocked the visit to the homeland by the chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) to express condolences before the bier of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Chongryon officials and compatriots, upon hearing the sad news which came like a bolt from the blue, strongly demanded the Japanese authorities allow the mourners delegation of Chongryon headed by the chief vice-chairman to visit the homeland.
					
					It was quite natural for the compatriots to take such action as they have revered Kim Jong Il as their father.
					
					He was the outstanding leader of Chongryon and benevolent father who brought happiness to the Koreans in Japan and carved out a future for their younger generation.
					
					He was the defender of justice as he led Chongryon as a Juche-based overseas compatriots organization and protected Chongryon and compatriots in Japan from the suppression by the reactionaries within and without Japan.
					
					He was, indeed, the great father of the nation who would be always remembered by Chongryon and compatriots in Japan.
					
					This clearly tells that it was a matter of most elementary ethics for the chief vice-chairman of Chongryon to visit the homeland and express condolences carrying with him the bitter grief of Koreans in Japan.
					
					That was why many officials and lawmakers of Japan urged the prime minister and the chief Cabinet secretary to allow the visit of the chief vice-chairman.
					
					But the prime minister and the chief Cabinet secretary objected to all this to the last moment. They claimed it was their policy not to recognize the reentry of the senior most official of Chongryon in case he pays a visit to the homeland to express condolences. This behavior was little short of rubbing salt into the grief-stricken Koreans.
					
					It was nothing but a base and rude behavior for the Japanese authorities to have blocked the condolatory visit to the homeland by a member of the Korean nation, far from sharing sorrow and sympathy with the neighbor saddened with the great loss.
					
					Nevertheless, the Japanese authorities are interpreting this rude behavior as "an expression of their firm will to settle the pending issues like abduction and the nuclear issue, etc."
					
					The Japanese reactionaries have put the DPRK-Japan relations at the lowest ebb, talking for years about the abduction issue which no longer exists and poses no problem. Yet, they are using it as a pretext for hurting the supreme leadership of the DPRK even today when the Korean nation is grieving the great loss. This is unpardonable in any respect.
					
					By doing so, the Japanese authorities are only beclouding the prospect of the relations between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					It was in pursuit of a base purpose that they took the above-said disgusting attitude.
					
					The support rate for the present Cabinet is now rapidly declining in Japan.
					
					The Japanese authorities feared that their flexible attitude towards the great loss the Korean nation suffered might cause the support rate for them to further sink. Precisely for this reason the present rulers took a high-handed attitude to meet the interests of the anti-DPRK forces who consider the abduction issue as a lever for keeping themselves alive.
					
					This is nothing but a mean and ridiculous behavior of the morally stupid guys who stoop to any infamy to gratify their political greed.
					
					It is as clear as daylight what miserable end they will meet.
					
					The Korean people came to more clearly know about the Japanese political pigmies while experiencing the great loss in bitter grief.
					
					It is a tragedy for Japan itself that those ignorant of any elementary ethics and morality and etiquette are administering state affairs, holding power.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will never forgive those who let loose the thrice-cursed vituperations against the Korean people who grieved the great loss to the nation but settle accounts with them to the last.

articles.title: Russian Political Party Lauds Brilliant and Heroic Life of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Political Party Lauds Brilliant and Heroic Life of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Executive Committee of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia made public a statement on Dec. 27 last year on the occasion of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The statement expressed profound condolences to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the membership of the Workers' Party of Korea, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and all the Korean people and referred to the brilliant heroic life of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					He held aloft the torch of struggle for the cause of socialism lit by President Kim Il Sung and proved before the world in practice the superiority of the socialist system to the capitalist system driving civilization to a worldwide crisis, the statement noted, and went on: 
					
					Kim Jong Il embodied the Songun politics which calls for attaching importance to military affairs as a political mode of the state. As a result, the DPRK's armed forces have been highly modernized, a new foundation has been laid for the defence industry and the country has had access even to nuclear deterrent for protecting its sovereignty from the imperialists' encroachment. 
					
					Thanks to his Songun politics a gigantic work was undertaken by the DPRK to update all fields of the national economy and the development of science and technology reached a new level.
					
					All the achievements made in the DPRK and its high international prestige clearly proved the greatness of Kim Jong Il as a far-sighted and sagacious leader. 
					
					The statement expressed the conviction that under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un the Korean people would as ever dynamically advance along the road indicated by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					The memory of Kim Jong Il, a great statesman, will always be cherished in the hearts of not only Korean people but progressive mankind, stressed the statement.

articles.title: Korean People Will Successfully Accomplish Kim Jong Il's Cause: Mongolian Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People Will Successfully Accomplish Kim Jong Il's Cause: Mongolian Organizations
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Units of Mongolia going by the august names of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu, the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations and the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society issued a joint statement on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Kim Jong Il wisely led the party, army and people for a long period, thus performing great feats for the country and its people, the statement said, and went on:
					
					HE Kim Jong Il conducted energetic ideological and theoretical activities, comprehensively developing in depth the immortal Juche idea, the Songun idea of President Kim Il Sung, firmly defending the revolutionary traditions and giving a steady continuity to the tradition of the Korean revolution.
					
					He set forth a grandiose goal for building a thriving nation and led the struggle of the Korean people to attain it.
					
					He, cherishing the firm will to carry out the last instructions of the President for national reunification, aroused all the Korean people to achieve the great national unity.
					
					He conducted energetic external activities for the victory of the socialist cause, world peace and stability and friendship and solidarity among the peoples, thus raising the position and authority of the DPRK in the international arena and performing undying feats for accomplishing the human cause of independence.
					
					We are convinced that the Korean people will turn the present sorrow into strength and courage and successfully accomplish the cause of the great HE Kim Jong Il, rallied close around HE supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Nepali Papers Carry Special Write-ups on Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Nepali Papers Carry Special Write-ups on Demise of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Nepali papers carried special write-ups on Dec. 30 last year on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Arpan carried several articles under the title "Kim Jong Il, great man" illustrated with a portrait of the leader.
					
					Under the sub-title "Distinguished thinker and theoretician" the paper said that Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, as an integral system of ideas and theories and methods of Juche.
					
					The most shining feat in Kim Jong Il's ideological and theoretical activities was that he developed in depth the Songun idea, it noted.
					
					Under the sub-titles "Elder of independent politics" and "Great master of leadership" the paper praised him for performing great feats for global independence through his energetic external activities and achieving the single-minded unity of the whole society.
					
					Nepal Today on Dec. 29 last year carried a special write-up accompanied with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					In an article titled "Tears of Korean people" the paper said Kim Jong Il, the distinguished great man recognized by the international community, was the great leader of the Korean people and the benevolent father from whom they could not live separated even a moment.

articles.title: It Is Good Fortune of Korean People to Have Kim Jong Un as Their Supreme Leader: Chinese Internet Website
articles.content:
It Is Good Fortune of Korean People to Have Kim Jong Un as Their Supreme Leader: Chinese Internet Website
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- An article titled "We Wish the Korean People All the Best" was posted on Chinese Internet website Xinlang on Dec. 28 last year.
					Since the very day leader Kim Jong Il demised, the dear respected Kim Jong Un has looked after the nation's all affairs in a uniform manner and all work has been carried out without hitch under his leadership, the article said, and went on:
					
					What does this mean.
					
					Firstly, senior officials of the party, state and army of the DPRK and all the people had already held Kim Jong Un in high esteem as their leader.
					
					Secondly, it tells that by having Kim Jong Un as the supreme leader of the party and state of the DPRK it will continue to advance along the road of socialism explored by the revolutionaries of the elder generation, not along the road of revisionism and capitalism, and the Korean people can continue to enjoy benefits from the state such as free education, free medical care and free provision of dwelling houses.
					
					Thirdly, the DPRK is fully capable of preventing and checking the distortion or revision of the revolutionary line provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation and the establishment of the capitalist private ownership.
					
					Recalling that some people are distorting and speaking ill of the reality of the DPRK, dancing to other's tune, the article continued:
					
					The DPRK, though not a big country, has achieved steady development despite the difficult situation created by the protracted moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges.
					
					It launched satellites by its own efforts and conducted nuclear tests, striking terror into the hearts of the imperialists.
					
					The people who have been under the great leaders generation after generation deserve reverence, respect and envy from mankind.
					
					We wish the Korean people all the best.

articles.title: News of Awarding of Title of DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il Reported by Foreign Media
articles.content:
News of Awarding of Title of DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il Reported by Foreign Media
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The news of awarding of the title of the DPRK hero to leader Kim Jong Il was reported by media and Internet homepages of various countries.
					On Dec. 30 last year Xinhua news said under the title "Title of DPRK hero awarded to leader Kim Jong Il" that a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was promulgated. 
					
					It went on:
					
					The decree noted that Kim Jong Il performed undying revolutionary feats for the country and its people, the times and history by wisely leading the party, army and people of the DPRK for decades.
					
					The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly said that the title of the DPRK hero and Gold Star Medal and Order of National Flag First Class are awarded to Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, in reflection of the unanimous desire of all the party members, service personnel and people.
					
					Huan Qiu Shibao, the People's Website, the Huan Qiu Website and other Internet homepages of China, ITAR-TASS, Voice of Russia and Jiji Press also reported the same news under such titles as "DPRK awards title of DPRK hero to leader Kim Jong Il and highly praises his feats" and "Title of DPRK hero awarded to leader Kim Jong Il who performed undying feats".

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Held in China
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Held in China
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show was held in Dalian, China from Dec. 20 to 22 last year to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					Displayed at the show hall were potted Kimilsungias and Kimjongilias in full bloom against the background of a large computer-aided electric picture depicting those flowers of the sun.
					
					Seen there were also photos and books introducing the fact that the immortal flowers of the sun won gold prizes and highest prizes at world horticultural expos and international flower shows.
					
					The hall was crowded with personages and masses of Dalian City.
					
					The visitors looked round flowers with solemn emotion.
					
					They wrote in the visitor's book such letters as "We hope that Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, famous flowers of Korea, will always come into full bloom in the minds of the Chinese and Korean peoples" and "May Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia come into full bloom all over the world".
					
					Meanwhile, the Kimjongilia show took place in Shenyang City on Dec. 23. last year.
					
					On display at the show hall were potted red Kimjongilias in full bloom against the background of a large computer-aided electric picture depicting the marshal star of the supreme commander flag on its center and words "December 24" and "20th Anniversary" on both sides.
					
					Personages of all social standings and masses of the city visited the show hall.

articles.title: Russia Strives to Beef up its Navy
articles.content:
Russia Strives to Beef up its Navy
Moscow, January 2 (KCNA) -- Russia has directed sustained big efforts to building up its naval forces.
					The Pacific Sea Fleet of Russia staged military exercises at the end of last year, in which warships launched missiles and torpedoes at underwater targets. The crew of the warships improved their combat tactics for protecting ships at anchor from any attack.
					
					Meanwhile, carrier-based aircraft of Russia's Arctic Sea Fleet performed training flights in the Mediterranean waters.
					
					The crew of the fleet's fighters and helicopters acquired aeronautics while making several flights a day.

articles.title: Iran Test-fires Medium-range Missile
articles.content:
Iran Test-fires Medium-range Missile
Tehran, January 2 (KCNA) -- Iran succeeded in test-launching a domestic medium-range missile undetected by radar in the military exercises of the navy forces in the country's southern waters on the New Year. 
					The vice-commander of the Navy said the missile is unaffected by any radar interference during its flight as it is equipped with the state-of-the-art technical system which is homemade.

articles.title: Iran Succeeds in Production of Uranium Fuel Rods
articles.content:
Iran Succeeds in Production of Uranium Fuel Rods
Tehran, January 2 (KCNA) -- Scientists and researchers of Iran's Atomic Energy Organization succeeded in production and test of its own uranium fuel rods for use in its nuclear power plants, according to the state television of this country on Sunday.
					The rods, made of natural uranium, were inserted into the core of Iran's nuclear research reactor after successfully going through all preliminary tests, the television reported.

articles.title: NATO Casualties Registered 565 Last Year
articles.content:
NATO Casualties Registered 565 Last Year
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- From January to December 30 last year the casualties of the NATO forces present in Afghanistan had been registered 565, most of them Americans.

articles.title: U.S. Jobless Claims Rise Again
articles.content:
U.S. Jobless Claims Rise Again
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The number of Americans initially applying for unemployment aid is increasing due to the continued economic depression.
					The U.S. Labor Department Thursday said that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 381 000 in the week ending Dec. 24 last year, a strong increase of 15 000 from the previous week's revised figure.

articles.title: Japan's Industrial Production Falls 2.6 Pct in November Last Year
articles.content:
Japan's Industrial Production Falls 2.6 Pct in November Last Year
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Japan's industrial production declined a seasonally adjusted 2.6 percent in November from a month earlier, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry of this country said in a preliminary report on Dec. 28 last year.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A 7-magnitude earthquake jolted the Izu islands of Japan on Sunday.
					The epicenter was under waters off Torishima Island.

articles.title: Tibet Autonomous Region to Build Highest New Airport
articles.content:
Tibet Autonomous Region to Build Highest New Airport
Beijing, January 2 (KCNA) -- The Tibet Autonomous Region of China is planning to build a new airport on the highest area in the world. 
					The height of the airport is 4 436 meters, 102 meters higher than the Bangda Airport in the area of Changdu in the same region.

articles.title: Cyclone Hits India
articles.content:
Cyclone Hits India
New Delhi, January 2 (KCNA) -- The cyclonic storm hit southeastern India on Dec. 30 last year, causing damage.
					The death toll from the cyclone has mounted to 42 and around 20 000 people were left homeless.
					
					Electricity power and telecommunication were cut off.
					
					The Indian authorities launched relief operations.

articles.title: Sexual Assaults Reported on Rise at U.S. Military Academies
articles.content:
Sexual Assaults Reported on Rise at U.S. Military Academies
Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- Sexual assaults at the United States' military academies increased sharply in the last academic year, according to a new report from its Department of Defense.
					Accounts of sexual assault rose by nearly 60 percent during the 2010-2011 academic program year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un es centro de la unidad: articulo de organizacion regional
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un es centro de la unidad: articulo de organizacion regional
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la Alianza Internacional de las Sociedades Regionales de Europa Oriental y de Asia Central para el Estudio de la Idea Juche y la Politica de Songun divulgo el 28 de diciembre del ano pasado en su sitio web un articulo intitulado "Por la unidad monolitica en torno a Kim Jong Un" adjuntando un retrato del fallecido. 
					El texto senala que en los momentos tristes de despedida del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la gente recuerda aquel julio de hace 17 anos cuando fallecio el Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					
					En aquel entonces, el partido, el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos unidos compactamente en torno al Dirigente se levantaron unanimemente en la materializacion del legado del Presidente y concluyeron victoriosamente la Marcha penosa, la forzada, apunta. 
					
					Hoy dia, el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un es el centro de la unidad de la nacion coreana y de todos los pueblos progresistas del mundo, destaca y vaticina que todo el mundo enviara total apoyo y solidaridad a el quien fortalece a Corea, baluarte del socialismo, y conduce la causa de la independencia de los pueblos de todos los paises.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion de mercancias en Almacen No.1 de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion de mercancias en Almacen No.1 de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la 3a exposicion de mercancias del Almacen No.1 de Pyongyang.
					En la exposicion fueron presentados mas de 5 millones 900 mil articulos de consumo de mas de 2 mil 800 variedades producidos por centenares de fabricas y empresas, los grupos de produccion de la rama de servicio comercial, las unidades asociadas o colaboradas,  etc.
					
					En comparacion con la 2a exposicion, esta vez, participaron mas de 70 unidades mas y las variedades se incrementaron mas de mil 400 mas.
					
					Al recorrer en julio del ano pasado la 2a exposicion, el gran Dirigente Kim Jong Il enseno que organizara mejor la proxima exposicion tanto en su dimension como en el significado, lo cual se convirtio en su legado.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 3 la ceremonia de inauguracion.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Ri Mu Yong, el ministro de Comercio Kim Pong Chol, los funcionarios interesados, los otros de los ministerios, los organos centrales y las unidades de aseguramiento de mercancias y los demas trabajadores.
					
					Ri Mu Yong pronuncio las palabras de inauguracion.
					
					Terminada la exposicion, los participantes recorrieron la sede de exposicion.
					
					Viendo nuevos productos hechos con las fibras autoctonas inclusive el manto y tela para el traje de vinalon, y el refresco gaseoso de manzana, perfume hecho con manzana, etc., ellos recordaron con emocion la imagen del Dirigente quien buscaba su placer en la alegria del pueblo.

articles.title: ACNC comenta acciones inmorales de Japon durante el duelo nacional
articles.content:
ACNC comenta acciones inmorales de Japon durante el duelo nacional
Pyongyang, 3 de enero (ACNC) -- A finales del ano pasado, todo el planeta sumergio en la profunda estela de pesar por el fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, gran hombre nacido de la humanidad y reconocido por el mundo. 
					Los jefes de Estado y gobierno, los lideres de partido, las personalidades de entidades y distintos sectores de muchos paises rindieron los mas sentidos tributos a la memoria del Dirigente y expresaron sinceros consuelos y estimulos al pueblo coreano. 
					
					Tambien en Japon, el ex premier Koizumi y otras personalidades enviaron mensajes de condolencias y visitaron la Casa Coreana para expresar profundo pesame. 
					
					Pero, las autoridades japonesas cometieron acciones inmorales ante la nacion coreana. 
					
					Mostraron oficialmente la posicion hostil de que  "no tienen previsto expresar condolencias a nivel gubernamental" y chismearon que "desean que el duelo nacional de Corea no tenga influencias negativas en la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana". 
					
					El 19 de diciembre, el premier japones Noda convoco la "reunion de seguridad" y ordeno a todos los ministerios y agencias intensificar la recogida de informaciones sobre el Norte de Corea y tomar todas las medidas necesarias. 
					
					El gobierno instalo la "sala de medidas del gabinete" en el centro de control de crisis de la oficina del premier e instruyo a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" y a la Agencia de Seguridad Maritima mantenerse en el estado de alerta. Y hablo de la "revision de las medidas necesarias para los japoneses residentes en el suelo surcoreano frente a la situacion emergente". 
					
					En aquellos momentos en que las personalidades de distintos estratos de los cinco continentes del mundo expresaban los mas sentidos pesames, Japon actuo asi con tanta hostilidad al pais vecino. 
					
					Las autoridades japonesas impidieron la visita de condolencias a la patria del vicepresidente responsable del Presidium del Comite Central de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon). 
					
					Al recibir la triste noticia sobre el deceso del Dirigente, los funcionarios de la Chongryon y los compatriotas residentes en Japon exigieron fuertemente a las autoridades japonesas permitir la visita a la patria de la delegacion de condolencias de la Chongryon presidida por el vicepresidente responsable. 
					
					El Dirigente fue destacado lider de la Chongryon, benevolo padre inolvidable de los compatriotas residentes en Japon y defensor de la justicia quien convirtio a la Chongryon como autoctona organizacion de compatriotas en ultramar y defendio esta organizacion y a los coreanos en Japon desde las represiones brutales de los reaccionarios internos y externos. 
					
					Pues, la visita de condolencias de la delegacion de la Chongryon es una cuestion relacionada con la moralidad mas elemental del ser humano. 
					
					Por eso, muchas personalidades japonesas, incluso los diputados, exigieron al premier y al director del secretariado del gabinete permitir esa visita. 
					
					Pero, la negaron hasta el final el premier Noda y el jefe del secretariado del gabinete, diciendo que si el maximo cuadro de la Chongryon realiza la visita de condolencias, no reconocerian su reentrada en el pais. 
					
					Las autoridades japonesas describen su actitud tan pueril como "la expresion de fuerte voluntad de solucionar los problemas pendientes como el de secuestro y el nuclear". 
					
					De esta manera, Japon ensombrecio las perspectivas de las relaciones Corea-Japon. 
					
					Entonces, ?que objetivo persiguen los gobernantes japoneses?
					
					Hoy dia, en Japon cae en picada el apoyo popular sobre el gabinete actual. 
					
					Las autoridades japonesas piensan que la actitud flexible ante el duelo nacional de Corea reduciria mas el apoyo. De ahi que tomaron actitud intransigente para congraciarse con las fuerzas anti-RPDC que toman el problema de secuestro como su medio de subsistencia. 
					
					Es un proceder tan grosero y villano que pueden cometer solo los politiqueros moralmente inmaduros que no vacilan en cometer cualesquier crimenes para satisfacer su ambicion politica. 
					
					En el periodo de gran duelo nacional, pudimos conocer mejor a los enanos politicos japoneses. 
					
					Es una tragedia para Japon el hecho de que el poder esta en manos de los que no tienen ni la mas elemental moralidad. 
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo coreanos no toleraran nunca a los que incurrieron en calumnias y maldades con respecto al duelo nacional, y ajustaran la cuenta final con ellos.
